On 11/29/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> C=E9dric,
>
> Follo=
wing up on what you said, I see "test" as a form of meta-data, but
> since =
it is only there by convention the compiler can't help you if you
> spell "=
tset" instead. Annotations are native meta-data so the IDE can help
> more.=



Yup, another good side of annotations.  That and the fact that they can
=
contain attributes, which can't easily be expressed with the prefix hack:
@=
Test(threadPoolSize =3D 10, invocationCount =3D 100).

-- 
C=E9dric
